heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: The last storm was on 02 February 2026 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (201°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: A significant windy period is on-going and is ranked 9th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 3 consecutive days beginning 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.0°C) and outside temperature (up 2.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
